chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant David W. Barhyte was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond on file.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to monitoring by his agent, including but not limited to random testing.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to monitoring by his agent, including but not limited to random testing.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with:  Gage Lewallen, Micayla Cork, Heather Calkins, Robert Wilkinson, Michelle Thayer, Jonathan Barhyte or any known illegal drug users or dealers.  In regards to contact with Jonathan Barhyte, DOC to determine contact while the defendant is incarcerated.  His agent must preapprove any contact with the aforementioned persons after defendant is released from prison.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Sentencing Hearing on April 3, 2017
DNA submission form

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  Parties have a copy of the PSI.  No corrections or changes noted.  No victim notification needed.  State recommended:  16CF27-  6 years total, bifurcated as 3 years of initial confinement and  3 years extended supervision.  In 16CF98-  4 years total, bifurcated as 2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  In 16CF50 -3 years total, bifurcated as 1 year initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  All concurrent.  Credit for 35 days.  Eligible for SAP and CIP. Extended supervision conditions:  consider adult treatment court.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defense says that is a joint recommendation.  

Court ordered:   16CF27-  6 years total, bifurcated as 3 years of initial confinement and  3 years extended supervision.  In 16CF98-  4 years total, bifurcated as 2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  In 16CF50 -3 years total, bifurcated as 1 year initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  All concurrent.  Credit for 35 days.  Eligible for SAP and CIP.  Extended supervision conditions:  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.   Not to use or possession any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia, or alcohol.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Subject to monitoring by DOC, including but not limited to random testing.   No contact with G. L., M. C., H. C., R. W,  M. T., J. B. (DOC to determine contact while defendant is incarcerated), unless his agent preapproves, or any other known drug dealers or users.  CC.   Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Sentencing hearing on April 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  Defense requesting an adjournment of the sentencing hearing.  SEH set for 4/3 at 1:30 pm.
Copy put in Attorney Linehan's basket
Sentencing hearing on March 6, 2017 at 10:00 am.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  State moved to amend Count 1 in 16CF27. Granted.  Information filed with the court.  Information in 16CF98 will be filed today.  Reading waived.  Defendant plead guilty to that charge.  Also, defendant plead guilty to count 1 in 16CF50, and Count 2 in 16CF98.  All other pending charges in criminal and traffic cases dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes.  CV cases remain open.  PSI will be requested. Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Priors and repeater allegations confirmed by the court.   Felony warnings given to the defendant.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Felony Bail Jumping, contrary to 946.49(1)(b), as a repeater, Possession of Methamphamine, contrary to 961.41(3g)(g), and Possession with intent, Amphetamine, contrary to 961.41(1m)(e)2.  PSI ordered due by 2/17.  SEH set for 3/6 at 10 am.  Bond continued.  Track CV cases.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on M.K. to appear at 1/12 jury trial
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on A.O. to appear at 1/12 jury trial
Plea hearing on January 9, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant appears with counsel Daniel Linehan.  DA Gerald Fox  appears for the State.  They have agreement on all the cases and can be set for plea date only prior to jury trial date.  Court sets for 1-09-17 at 10:00 for plea hearing.  No sentencing only plea.  Civil cases continue to track.

Jury trial - 12 person on January 12, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on December 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  Set for jury trial.  Set oldest felony first.  Set 16CF50, 166CF42  and 16CF27 for 1 day trial.  16CF98 2 day trial.  Track all other cases.
Status conference on July 28, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Pre-trial conference on June 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant appears in person in custody from Jackson County Jail with counsel Daniel Linehan.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  This will be a waiver of the preliminary hearing.  Attorney Linehan files the waiver form.  Court performs colloquy with defendant regarding his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court makes a finding that he FVKI waives his right to a preliminary hearing on 16CF27.  He is bound over for trial.  Defense waives reading of the Information.  Not guilty plea entered on all counts.  Attorney Linehan requests PTC and STC dates and states he's hoping to come up with a global resolution of all cases.  Court sets pre-trial for 6-15 and a status for 6-27 at 3:00.  Court wants to know by that date what cases should be scheduled for.  Bond continues.  All cases are to track together.

Defendant appeared with counsel Daniel Linehan.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Attorney Linehan states he will schedule the preliminary hearing on 16CF42 for 30 minutes with the J.A.  Other cases will continue to track.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  No agreement yet.  Set for preliminary hearing.  45 min.

This bond covers cases 16CF42 and 16CF27: Cash bond posted on 16CF27 February 27, 2016 covers this case also:   Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: G. L. and H. C..  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.

L. and H. C..  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.

Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Court questioned the defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived the time limits for holding the preliminary hearing.
